knimeNode.name: SnpEff
knimeNode.shortDescription: SnpEff annotates and predicts the effects of variants on genes.

fullDescription.intro:
SnpEff annotates and predicts the effects of variants on genes (such as amino acid changes).
Source: http://snpeff.sourceforge.net/SnpEff.html

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Set a threshold for repeated execution.Only used if HTE is enabled in the preference page.
Set the path to the snpEff installation.

In order to produce the annotation, SnpEff requires a database.
For more information, see http://snpeff.sourceforge.net/SnpEff.html
Set the path to the input vcf file.

Specify whether to add loss of function (LOF) and Nonsense mediated decay (NMD) tags.
Loss of function assessment: SnpEff can estimate if a variant is deemed to have a LOF on the protein.
Nonsense mediated decay (NMD) assessment: Some mutations may cause mRNA to be degraded thus not translated into protein. NMD analysis marks mutations that are estimated to trigger nonsense mediated decay.

tab.name: Sequence change filter
tab.option: By settings thresholds for minimum quality value and for minimum coverage, variants with a bad quality value and/or a low coverage can be removed.

This option allows you to filter variants by the following mutation types:
Analyze deletion only
Analyze insertion only
Analyze homozygous variants only
Analyze heterozygous variants only
Analyze SNPs only
Analyze MNPs only
